Assessment Class Object¶

Assess the damages and decision values at target sites using ground motion predictions and demand parameters.

create_RV(self, im_tool[, dir_im, …])

Read and store IM and rupture data from files.

generate_IM(self, nsamp[, flag_corr_d, …])

Perform multivariate random sampling of PGA and PGV using means and sigmas for all scenarios.

generate_EDP(self, param, method, …)

Using the simulated intensity measures to calculate engineering demand parameters.

generate_DM(self, param, method, …)

Using the simulated intensity measures and engineering demand parameters to calculate damage measures.

generate_DV(self, param, method, …)

Using the damage measures to estimate decision variables/values.
model.assessment.create_RV(self, im_tool, dir_im=None, path_siteloc=None, rate_min=0.0001, im_list=['pga', 'pgv'], \*\*kwargs)¶

Read and store IM and rupture data from files.

Parameters
im_toolstr

tool used to generate intensity measures: currently either EQHazard or EventCalc

dir_imstr

directory containing the IM files

path_sitelocstr

path of the file containing the site locations

im_liststr, array, optional

list of intensity measures to pull and create random variables for; default = [pga, pgv]

rate_minfloat, optional

cutoff for rate of occurrence for scenarios; default = 0.0001 (~975 yr)

Additional parameters for **EventCalc tool**
flag_exportboolean, optional

flag whether to simplify the matrix for sigma total and inter and export the reduced-size files

Returns
_RV_dictdict

stored IM moments, eq. rupture information, and site data, to be used for generating IMs

model.assessment.generate_IM(self, nsamp, flag_corr_d=True, flag_corr_T=True, T_pga=0.01, T_pgv=1.0, method_d='jayaram_baker_2009', method_T='baker_jayaram_2008', \*\*kwargs)¶

Perform multivariate random sampling of PGA and PGV using means and sigmas for all scenarios. Spatial and spectral orrelations can be applied.

Parameters
nsampfloat

number of samples/realizations

flag_corr_dboolean, optional

decision on performing correlation between sites (distance); default = True

flag_corr_Tboolean, optional

decision on performing correlation between periods; default = True

T_pgafloat, optional

[sec] approximate period for PGA to be used in spectral correlation; default = 0.01 sec

T_pgvfloat, optional

[sec] approximate period for PGV to be used in spectral correlation; default = 1.0 sec

method_d = str, optional

method to use for spatial correlation; default = jayaram_baker_2009

method_T = str, optional

method to use for spectral correlation; default = baker_jayaram_2008

For additional parameters, see the respective methods under :func:`im.corr_spatial.py` and :func:`im.corr_spectral.py`
Returns
_IM_dictdict

stored samples for all intensity measures and rupture scenarios

model.assessment.generate_EDP(self, param, method, flag_clear_dict, \*\*kwargs)¶

Using the simulated intensity measures to calculate engineering demand parameters.

Parameters
paramstr

demand parameter to calculate; options are corr_spt, corr_cpt, liq, ls, gs, land, ts, surf, subsurf (see edp() for meaning of the options)

methodstr

method/procedure to use to calculate the demand; see edp() for available methods.

flag_clear_dictboolean, optional

True to clear the calculated demands or False to keep them.

For method parameters, refer to the method documentation under :func:`edp`.
Returns
outputvaries

[varies] output depends on the target demand and methods.

model.assessment.generate_DM(self, param, method, flag_clear_dict, \*\*kwargs)¶

Using the simulated intensity measures and engineering demand parameters to calculate damage measures.

Parameters
paramstr

damage parameter to calculate; options are rr (more to be added, see dm() for meaning of the options)

methodstr

method/procedure to use to calculate the damage; see dm() for available methods.

flag_clear_dictboolean, optional

True to clear the calculated damages or False to keep them.

For method parameters, refer to the method documentation under :func:`dm`.
Returns
outputvaries

[varies] output depends on the target damage measure and methods.

model.assessment.generate_DV(self, param, method, flag_clear_dict, \*\*kwargs)¶

Using the damage measures to estimate decision variables/values.

Parameters
paramstr

damage parameter to calculate; options are TBD (more to be added, see dm() for meaning of the options)

methodstr

method/procedure to use to calculate the damage; see dm() for available methods.

flag_clear_dictboolean, optional

True to clear the calculated damages or False to keep them.

For method parameters, refer to the method documentation under :func:`dm`.
Returns
outputvaries

[varies] output depends on the target damage measure and methods.
